thread.title: Lyft will offer free DeLorean rides in New York Wednesday
thread.title_full: Lyft will offer free DeLorean rides in New York Wednesday - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Lyft will offer free DeLorean rides in New York Wednesday
text:
Verizon/via YouTube Verizon and Lyft are teaming up to give rides to app users with a Delorean, in honor of the "future" date October 21, 2015, popularized by "Back To The Future." If you've always wanted to ride in a DeLorean, now is your time.
Lyft has partnered with Verizon and Universal to offer free DeLorean rides Wednesday to celebrate "Back to the Future" day, which is none other than the date in which Marty and Doc travel to in the 1989 sequel: Oct. 21, 2015.
The promotion will last from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. and can be requested by pressing the "McFly Mode" toggle on the app.
Free rides will last up to 20 minutes and will "stay under 88 mph." Unfortunately, these vehicles won't have functioning Flux Capacitors or flying wheels. So where you're going, there must be roads.
This is not the first time a rideshare company offers free DeLorean rides. Back in 2013, Uber also offered DeLorean rides in San Francisco in partnership with General Electric.
Lyft is not sharing the number of DeLoreans that will travel around the city, but it did say the cars are being shipped from all over the country.
